title: Omar Mohammed (Mosul Eye) - Forgetting is a Crime
description:
He is the man behind Mosul Eye, the blog which kept a record of and informed the world about ISIS-occupied Mosul, the man who lived next door to ISIS leadership and yet confounded their attempts to discover and kill him, who won the admiration of journalists and readers worldwide, of General Petraeus, and most importantly, his fellow citizens in their darkest hours.

Omar Mohammed honors TheCommonToad by joining the podcast, and discusses his life growing up in Mosul, his impressions of the American occupation, the ruthless takeover of ISIS, and he reflects on lessons of history, love of culture and art, and his hopes for the future.

3:30 – Omar Mohammed's beginnings, and his family's long history with Mosul
10:29 – A young Omar watches the Americans roll into his city
15:22 – In the midst of violence, Omar goes to college and becomes a teacher
27:58 – 2014: ISIS comes to Mosul, and the everyone's surprise, stays
33:12 – Omar makes the decision to resist
37:33 – Mosul Eye is born
42:20 – Omar's 'characters,' and their great cost
47:55 – A witness to horror
50:32 – Why do people join ISIS?
55:21 – The hope Omar brought to his fellow citizens
58:35 – The richness of culture in Mosul
1:08:10 – Is there a role for America and Americans in Iraq now?
1:14:41 – What disturbs and puzzles Omar about the 'Western' world today?
1:23:18 – What is Omar working on now?
1:27:18 – The concert at Nineveh
